summary:
Adds a container to RiverWood Trader's first floor, sharing its content amongst multiple games.
Should soon include networking capabilities, to allow chest content sharing over a circle of friends.
descriptionHtml:
[b][color=yellow]Description[/color][/b]

This simple mod adds a container to RiverWood Trader's first floor, making its content available between multiple games/characters.

Initiated on April 7th 2014 (a few hours ago), this is my first Skyrim mod ever.

Currently only provide one [u]single container[/u], but later updates may add more of those containers to various locations, so you don't have to return to RiverWood to use the container.

A later build will allow chest content sharing over the internet between friends.
v0.1.4 adds foundations toward this goal, by the use of our own custom skse plugin allowing us to create new papyrus functions coming from our c++ skse plugin.


[b][color=orange]News[/color][/b]

* April 17th 2014 : added first basic networking capability to our skse plugin, actually used in-game to execute a http get request to a remote server on a given ingame event, showing response body ingame as a first test.
Now adding some more basic filesystem and string manipulation functions so we can format and store remote response locally, so it can be used with the current in-place mechanism.
Http post already implemented in our skse plugin, will have to make it available as a papyrus function and test it properly.

Next i'll document the various requests made by the plugin, and the expected responses, and will run a demo server accepting multiple "friends circles" so you can try it out without configuring your own server or modifying SharedContainer.ini


* April 16th 2014 : v0.1.4 is out, including MCM-based configuration, custom skse plugin soon allowing us to interact with external world without the need for an external application.
A few custom papyrus functions were added so we can actually parse our ini file and get user-selected remote server to use.



[b][color=yellow]Features[/color][/b]

* standard chest sharing its content amongst local characters/games.
* MCM-based configuration for supported settings. (server selection still done through .ini file)
* chest content and local operations exported to local datafiles (json).
* imports operations (additions/deletions) from external source at regular interval (using plaintext file eventually created by thirdparty application ; same json document format).



[b][color=yellow]Planned features[/color][/b]

* extend the content sharing to circles of friends.
* support for vanilla items associations (vanilla enchantment applied to a vanilla item for example)
* simple text messaging capabilities (with some skyUI tricks combined to our custom skse plugin ?)




[b][color=yellow]Current limitations[/color][/b]

* Modified items (custom enchants, non-vanilla/dlc items) will not appear properly on different characters ; please only store unmodified items. (Will investigate, to eventually store custom enchants properties and restore them properly in later updates)


[b][color=yellow]Requirements[/color][/b]

* skse ( [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/url] ) - built with [color=red]skse 1.7.0[/color]
* PapyrusUtil by meh321 ( [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49098/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49098/[/url] )
* SkyUI >= 4.1 ([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/[/url] )



[b][color=yellow]Installation[/color][/b]

* manually install skse ( [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/url] )
* use NexusModManager to install PapyrusUtil by meh321 ( [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49098/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49098/[/url] )
* use NexusModManager to install SkyUI ( [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/[/url] )
* use NexusModManager to install this mod


[b][color=red]WARNING[/color][/b]

This mod is still in alpha stage ; do not store items you can't afford to lose in the shared chest.


[b][color=yellow]Where to find the container[/color][/b]

First container is located at [u]RiverWoord[/u] :

Enter RiverWood's trader, [u]go upstair[/u] and have a look on the drawer in a corner of the room.
Chest is on first floor (european system) or second floor (US system) ; meaning you have to go upstair once from ground level to find it.


[b][color=yellow]How to use it ?[/color][/b]

Activate the mod, enter RiverWood Trader, go upstairs and open the chest.

If this is the first time you're using this mod, chest will be empty.

Just drop a few items into the chest and close it.

From another game, repeat the process ; content stored from your other character is now available.



[b][color=green]Troubleshooting[/color][/b]

During mod alpha stage, you may run into inventory inconsistencies between upgrades.

You can follow those steps to fully reset the mod :

* disable SharedContainer mod
* load your save game
* make a new save
* delete Data/SKSE/Plugins/StorageUtilData/SharedContainer*.txt
* re-enable SharedContainer
* load your save game, created on step 3



[b][color=yellow]Datafiles Location[/color][/b]

[u]Audience:[/u] developers / modders.

SharedContainer plugin stores its datafiles under the following relative path:
Data/SKSE/Plugins/StorageUtilData/SharedContainer*.txt

Each file contains a json document.

[u]data files list :[/u]

* SharedContainerData.txt : inventory list ; updated after every chest close event. This file is always created once the container was closed at least once.

* SharedContainerLocalAdditions.txt : list of items added to the inventory by the last local player. If you're always using the same character, this datafile will grow continuously until external application processes data. If you switches between local characters, Only the last character used data will be available here.
This file content is updated after every chest close event, appending additions made during the time chest was open.
This file may not be generated if mod's ini files tells us not to generate it (v>0.1.2 behaviour).

* SharedContainerLocalDeletions.txt : list of items locally removed from the inventory. Same behaviour as local additions regarding data persistency.
This file content is updated after every chest close event, appending deletions made during the time chest was open.
This file may not be generated if mod's ini files tells us not to generate it (v>0.1.2 behaviour).

* SharedContainerRemoteOperations.txt : list of remote operations done remotely on inventory (additions/deletions). This file is created by an external application responsible for synchronizing multiple remote peers (applying remote operations locally).
This file content is deleted once remote operations have been included locally (happens at regular intervals).
This file content may not be processed if mod's ini file tells us not to (v>0.1.2 behaviour).




[b][color=yellow]Mod configuration[/color][/b]

[u]Audience:[/u] advanced users.

Since v0.1.4 major mod parameters may be altered "on the fly" using MCM.

A .ini file is used for settings we can't manage through MCM (user input strings) :
Data/SharedContainer.ini

[u]Sample ini file (as in v0.1.4) :[/u]
[quote]
[SCdebug]
sTestString="some random string"
[SCdataexchange]
sRemoteHttpServerUrl="http://yourhostname.tld/path/to/docs/"
[/quote]

Sections and keys should be self-explanatory ; will give more informations in a later update.



[b][color=yellow]Accessing data from other mods[/color][/b]

[u]Audience:[/u] modders.

Thanks to PapyrusUtils, other mods may access current list of stored items.

A Formlist is attached to the container, providing informations on currently stored items.
Formlist is stored under the key 'storeditems'.
(see StorageUtils script source file (headers-like) file from PapyrusUtils for more informations).





[b][color=yellow]Updates[/color][/b]

* April 16th 2014: v0.1.4 uploaded (see Changes tab for more informations).
* April 10th 2014 : v0.1.3 uploaded (see Changes tab for more informations).
* April 8th 2014 : v0.1.2 uploaded (see Changes tab for more informations).
* April 7th 2014 : v0.1.1 uploaded - initial release.
author: gira42

files.name: SharedContainer
files.changelogHtml:
0.1.1 to 0.1.2 :
* now dumping local operations to separate files, for upcoming remote synchronisation between peers
* now also processing remote operations (items added/removed to/from container by remote players)
* better content management, let the game handle per-session operations.
* will now import content only once per session ; on object init when possible, on first opening otherwise.
* reduced notification verbosity ; will now only signal initial import startup / end.

files.name: SharedContainer
files.changelogHtml:
0.1.2 to 0.1.3 :
* (fix) prevent initial clearance from adding entries to localdeletions list.
* now reading Data/SharedContainer.ini entries
** now using 'bNotifyPlayer' key from 'SCdataexchange' section to notify player of remote operations processing
** now using 'bProcessRemoteData' key from 'SCdataexchange' section to eventually skip remote operations processing
** now using 'bExportLocalOperations' key from 'SCdataexchange' section to eventually skip local operations exports
* When enabled, remote operations checks happens at 1 minute interval (real time, whatever TimeScale is set to)
** include 0.03 low limit safety, to prevent game freeze (see RegisterForUpdateGameTime() wiki page at creationkit.com)
** note that initial remote operations processing will not trigger during the first 2 minutes (real time) when entering a game.
* better package directory structure

files.name: SharedContainer
files.changelogHtml:
0.1.3 to 0.1.4 :
* mcm-based configuration menu added.
* previous .ini settings moved to MCM configuration.
* remote server to use for exchange now moved to .ini file (MCM doesn't provide free text input).
* now using our own skse plugin, allowing us to add new papyrus functions.
* now using our own .ini parser to actually allow mod settings tuning.
* networking code not yet available ; this is a cleanup/rewrite build.
